doc:
Nigel Hawthorne https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nigel_Hawthorne 0 Sir Nigel Barnard Hawthorne (5 April 1929 – 26 December 2001) was an English actor. He portrayed Sir Humphrey Appleby, the Permanent Secretary in the 1980s sitcom Yes Minister and the Cabinet Secretary in its sequel, Yes, Prime Minister. For this role, he won four BAFTA TV Awards for Best Light Entertainment Performance. He won the BAFTA Award for Best Actor in a Leading Role and was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Actor for portraying King George III in The Madness of King George (1994). He later won the BAFTA TV Award for Best Actor, for the 1996 series The Fragile Heart. He was also an Olivier Award and Tony Award winner for his work in the theatre. Sir_Nigel_Barnard_Hawthorne ( 5_April_1929 – 26_December_2001 ) was an_English_actor . He portrayed Sir_Humphrey_Appleby , the_Permanent_Secretary in the_1980s_sitcom_Yes_Minister and the_Cabinet_Secretary in its_sequel , Yes , Prime_Minister . For this_role , he won four_BAFTA_TV_Awards for Best_Light_Entertainment_Performance . He won the_BAFTA_Award for_Best_Actor in a_Leading_Role and was_nominated for the_Academy_Award for_Best_Actor for portraying King_George_III in The_Madness of King_George_(_1994_) . He later won the_BAFTA_TV_Award for Best_Actor , for the_1996_series The_Fragile_Heart . He was also an_Olivier_Award_and_Tony_Award_winner for his_work in the_theatre .
